Yeah, I don't get that.  Zyra was OP on release.  Her kit is not toxic.  There's a huge difference.

That's why I always think of Zyra as Morello's champion, not CertainlyT's.

Her Q and E interacting with W to produce stationary attackers? That's Morello.

That random CDR/level on her W? That's CertainlyT.

To be fair, champion power creep and nerfs have actually made Darius, Zyra, and Yasuo into pretty balanced champs overall.  Thresh's kit will always be overladed with utility, and Kalista's mobility is crazy.  Zed is in a good spot, other than the fact that he can push way better than mana based mid laners.

Not gonna lie, I got a bit salty when they said something along the lines of: 

 "oh well in the early design stages we wanted Thresh to do everything! Yeah we were trying him out in the top lane, jungle, and support!"

"haha, yeah, so like Lee Sin *chuckles from rioters*"

It was pretty cool to see that they have mixed and match champion concepts before (turns out Zigg's concept art was a man in a suit of armor chucking bombs, while Nautilus was a Yordle who had an anchor, so they swapped aesthetics. Or something like that; after a while I was tabbed out and using the stream as background noise.)

I'm scared to defend CertainlyT, but I think his champions are super fun, albeit at the enemy's expense. I think they need to lose a couple passives and fine tune some numbers, then maybe people would start to like them, maybe. 


Maybe.

Nobody is saying that they aren't well-designed in the sense that they're fun to play.  He nails it in that regard.  What he fails at utterly is making champs that are both fun to play as *and* fun to play against, which I think is the real way you can identify champs as well-designed.  I've never played against a Kalista, Yasuo, or Zed and thought, "Oh boy, I'm gonna have a fun game!"  Even if I beat the living hell out of them, I don't have fun.  Sure, I feel *proud* that I was able to outplay a CertainlyT champ, but that's about it.

I still prefer play against Zed or Yasuo rather than Akali, for example. I think (or rather hope) Kalista will reach that state soon or later. Maybe they are overloaded? Maybe, but at least are champions that have the ways to be balanced because they have lots of tools. Just look at Kassadin: he only has a tool (his ult, but well, you could argue the Q too), and since it is really hard to balance... butchering.

While his champions are certainly "fun", that's because he designs them like a hyperactive 12-year old. "Ooh, I know! He should be able to dash through EVERYTHING, like *zip zip zip zip zip* like those guys in Bleach! And the damage should stack up with each hit because, uh, because he's gaining speed as he goes! And he should be able to throw out the wind so hard it knocks people on the other side of the screen into the air! WHOOSH! And I know what'd be even cooler, if he could use wind to block ANYTHING ANYONE SHOOTS AT HIM! And, and, he should get double crit because he's a *samurai* and they have the sharpest, coolest swords EVER! And for his ult, he should *teleport across the screen* to do an awesome combo on anyone who's been knocked in the air, or, or, *in the middle of a jump!* What? Too much? What do you mean 'too much'? Eh, OK then, just give him a wind shield that automatically goes up when he gets hit because, because, because he's a wind samurai. I think I'll call him... YASUO!"

Seriously, why did Riot even hire him, considering his complete lack of industry experience? And having hired him, why didn't they assign someone reasonable to stand behind him and look over his shoulder saying "No, young padawan, Darius doesn't NEED to gain movement speed every time someone is bleeding" or "No, Zed doesn't NEED to gain a % bonus to his bonus AD for every rank in his W".

For god's sake, his name is short for *Certainly True Damage!* How many warning signs did you need?!

Is this serious?

Um, no, it's because a lot of people that don't play his champions dislike him for making some of the most overpowered champs in recent years.  His champs aren't fun to play against.  I actually *like* Thresh, but at least I can acknowledge that he's overloaded and too strong.

I'm sorry, but if every champ a designer releases is bullshit strong on release, there's 3 possibilities: 1) the kits themselves are poorly designed, which is because the designer isn't good, 2) the balance team is either trying to get more people to buy the champ or don't actually understand the champ, or 3) both 1 and 2.  Looking at the release kits of most of his champs, I'm pretty sure it's situation #1 or #2.
